data.title: James Robinson Planché Papers: Finding Aid
data.text:
Aberdeen, George Hamilton Gordon, Earl of, 1794-1860. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1841, Dec. 13), London (Eng.). JP 2

Adam, Adolphe, 1803-1856. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([before 1856]). JP 3

In French.

[Adelaide, Queen, consort of William IV, King of Great Britain, 1792-1849]. [Request for two books], A.N. (1 p.), ([before 1849]). JP 4

Adolphus Frederick, Prince, Duke of Cambridge, 1774-1850. 1 letter to Richard More O’Ferrall, 1797-1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), (1839, Nov. 25), Kew (Eng.). JP 5

Adolphus Frederick, Prince, Duke of Cambridge, 1774-1850. 1 letter to [My dear Sir], A.L.S. (1 p.), (1848, July 28), London (Eng.). JP 6

Ainsworth, William Harrison, 1805-1882. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796- 1880], A.L.S. (2 p.), (1829, Dec. 5), London (Eng.). JP 7

Airy, George Biddell, Sir, 1801-1892. 1 letter to Richard More O’Ferrall, 1797-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1840, Jan. 30), Greenwich (Eng.). JP 8

On verso: A.N.S. from O’Ferrall.

[Anglesey, Henry Paget, Marquess of, 1797-1869]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L. (2 p.), (1839, June 3), London (Eng.). JP 12

Written in third person.

Arnold, Samuel James, 1774-1852. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (1 p.), (1826, June 3),[London (Eng.)]. JP 14

Bacon, Elizabeth. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (2 p.), (1880, June 3), Langley (Bucks., Eng.). JP 15

Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Bendall, Gertrude. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (8 p.), (1881, June 1), London (Eng.). JP 24

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Bendall, Sydney. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1880, June 8), Chelsea (Eng.). JP 27

Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Bendall, Sydney. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (3 p.), (1881, May 6), On board “The Chevalier.” JP 28

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

[Blessington, Marguerite, Countess of, 1789-1849]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L. (2 p.), (1836, Feb. 3), London (Eng.). JP 34

Written in third person. [Bradford, Orlands George Charles Brideman, Earl of, 1819-1898]. 1 letter to J. R. (James

Brock, E. P. Loftus. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (3 p.), (1880, Dec. 30), London (Eng.). JP 40

Note: drawing originally enclosed now cataloged in Ephemera. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Bunn, Alfred, 1796?-1860. 1 letter to John McDonnell, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1834, [July 2]), London (Eng.). JP 45

Chatto & Windus (Firm). 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1881, May 19), London (Eng.). JP 54

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Chatto & Windus (Firm). 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1881, May 20), London (Eng.). JP 55

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Croker, T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon), 1831-1912. 1 letter to [My Dear Sir], A.L.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1880?]), London (Eng.). JP 68

Note: “copy for correction;” only corrections are in the hand of Croker. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Cushman, Charlotte, 1816-1876. 1 note to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.N.S. (1 p.), (1855, May 8), London (Eng.). JP 71

Daly, Richard, 1758-1813. [Receipt to Thomas Pelham for £30 for the use of the boxes of the Theatre Royal for the celebration of the Prince of Wales’s birthday], A.D.S. (1 p.), (1795, Aug. 13). JP 72

[D’Egville, James T. Hervé, ca. 1806-1880]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796- 1880, A.L. (1 p.), ([before 1880]), [London (Eng.)]. JP 74

Written in third person. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Fairbrother, Louise. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), (1847, July 10). JP 93

Cataloger’s Note: after 1859 and her “marriage” to George, Duke of Cambridge, she was styled “Louise FitzGeorge.”

Farren, Percy, 1784-1843. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1826?], June 5), [London (Eng.)]. JP 97

Fawcett, Mr. (John), 1768-1837. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (1 p.), (1826, July 5), London (Eng.). JP 99

[Frederick Augustus, Prince, Duke of York and Albany, 1763-1827]. To Samuel Hulse, 1747 or 8-1837, D.S. (1 p.), (1802, Apr. 10), London (Eng.). JP 105

Note: marked “copy;” written and signed by a secretary.

George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820. To the Justices of Assize for the Northern Circuit, the High Sheriff of the County of Lancaster…: [Warrant to withhold execution of any sentence against James Cunningham, charged with murder], D.S. (4 p.), (1794, Mar. 4), London (Eng.). JP 109

Signed by: Henry Dundas, Viscount Melville, 1742-1811.

George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820. To the Warden of the Stannaries in…Cornwall and Devon: [Warrant of authority to grant commissions], D.S. (4 p.), (1812, Aug. 15), London (Eng.). JP 110

Signed by: George IV, King of Great Britain, 1762-1830, as Prince Regent, and Henry Addington, Viscount Sidmouth, 1757-1844.

[George, Prince, Duke of Cambridge, 1819-1904]. [Subscription request for one copy of Testimonial Edition of Planché’s Extravaganzas], Printed form, filled in (1 p.), (1879, Aug. [14]). JP 112

Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Gibson, Arethusa Susannah Milner. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (3 p.), ([ca. 1860?], June 3), London (Eng.). JP 114

Gilbert, W. S. (William Schwenck), 1836-1911. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), ([ca. 1865?], June 10), London (Eng.). JP 115

Glover, Julia, 1779-1850. 1 letter to [My Dear Sir], A.L.S. (2 p.), ([before 1850]). JP 118

Note: addressee name illegible.

Halliwell-Phillipps, J. O. (James Orchard), 1820-1889. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1845?], May 1), [London (Eng.)]. JP 129

Harlowe, Sarah, 1765-1852. [Signature on a ticket of admission to “Speed the Plough,” at Drury Lane], Printed form, filled in (1 p.), (1820, June 28), London (Eng.). JP 131

Howard of Glossop, Edward George Fitzalan-Howard, Baron, 1818-1883. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (2 p.), (1868, June 13), London (Eng.). JP 147

Jerrold, Douglas William, 1803-1857. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1850?], May 4), London (Eng.). JP 152

Knight, Edward, 1774-1826. [Signature on a ticket of admission to the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane], A.D.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1820?], June 22), [London (Eng.)]. JP 170

Knight, Mary Anne Povey, 1804-1861. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([1828?], June 7), London (Eng.). JP 172

Laporte, P. F. (Pierre François), 1799-1841. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796- 1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1827, June 5). JP 177

In French.

Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson), 1794-1854. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796- 1880], A.L.S. (2 p.), (1839, June 5), London (Eng.). JP 182

Londesborough, Albert Denison, Baron, 1805-1860. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (3 p.), ([ca. 1856?], Mar. 6), St. Leonards on Sea (Eng.). JP 184

Londonderry, Frances Anne Vane, Marchioness of, 1800-1865. 1 letter to Messrs. Graham or Murray, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1849, Mar. 10), Bath (Eng.). JP 187

Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron, 1803-1873. 1 letter to [J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880], A.L.S. (1 p.), (1832, July 7), [London (Eng.)]. JP 193

Lytton, Rosina Bulwer Lytton, Baroness of, 1802-1882. “Monody on the Year 1847:” [poem], A.MS.S. (3 p.), (1847, Dec. 31). JP 194

Lytton, Rosina Bulwer Lytton, Baroness of, 1802-1882. “To My Children:” [poem], A.MS.S. (3 p.), (1838, June 27), Bath (Eng.). JP 195

Mackarness, Edith. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1881, May 7), Margate (Eng.). JP 197

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Mackarness, Mrs. (Matilda Anne), 1826-1881. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (2 p.), ([1881], Feb. 5). JP 198

Also enclosed: photograph of Matilda Anne Mackarness(?). Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Mackarness, Mrs. (Matilda Anne), 1826-1881. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (2 p.), ([1881], Apr. [4?]), [London (Eng.)]. JP 199

Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Merivale, Herman Charles, 1839-1906. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (3 p.), (1880, Feb. 10), Kingston-on-Thames (Eng.). JP 210

With envelope. Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

Morton, Thomas, 1764-1838. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1831, June 5), London (Eng.). JP 220

[Norfolk, Henry Fitzalan-Howard, Duke of, 1847-1917]. 1 letter to [Col. Renton and the officers of the First Sussex Rifle Volunteers], A.L. (1 p.), (1874, Nov. 4), Arundel (Eng.). JP 226

Written in third person.

Oxenford, John, 1812-1877. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1855, May 3), London (Eng.). JP 232

Cataloger’s Note: this might be the signature of Parry’s father, John Parry, 1776-1851. [Paton, Mary Ann, 1802-1864]. 1 letter to Richard Brinsley Peake, 1792-1847, A.L. (2 p.), ([ca. 1835?]), [London (Eng.)]. JP 234

Written in third person.

Peel, Robert, 1788-1850. 1 letter to George Browne and Rev. W. R. Bedford, A.L.S. (1 p.), (1835, July 11), London (Eng.). JP 236

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “Mad[am]e Vestris’s answer to the Alphabet:” [poem], A.MS.S. (1 p.), (1834, Dec. 29). JP 243

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “St. Agnes from the Chapel at Goodrich Court:” [pencil sketch], A.MS.S. (1 p.), ([before 1880]). JP 249

[Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880]. “Translated by desire of the Countess of Jersey:” [lines to be added to a manuscript], A.MS.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1850?]). JP 251

[Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880]. “What would your gracious figure?:” [watercolor sketch of Hamlet], A.MS. (1 p.), ([before 1880]). JP 252

[Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880]. “With Mr. Planché’s assistance the Editors are enabled to furnish the following complete list of his Dramatic Works, to which are added dates and places…:” [list of Planché’s works], A.MS. (13 p.), ([ca. 1879?]). JP 253

Note: damaged and fragile. Acquired from W. A. Myers, Mar. 1972.

Pope, Alexander, 1763-1835. [Signature on ticket of admission to “Speed the Plough,” at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane], Printed form, filled in (1 p.), (1820, June 28), London (Eng.). JP 256

Reed, Priscilla, 1818-1895. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (4 p.), (1879, Apr. 2), London (Eng.). JP 263

Acquired from I. K. Fletcher, Feb. 1950.

[Rutland, Mary Isabella Manners, Duchess of, 1756-1831]. 1 letter to [Mr.] ----- Beach, A.L. (1 p.), (1827, Feb. 3), Belvoir Castle (Leics., Eng.). JP 274

Written in third person.

St. Albans, Harriot Mellon, Duchess of, 1777?-1837. [Signature on admission to her box at Drury Lane], A.D.S. (1 p.), (1828, Nov. 15), London (Eng.). JP 275

Sefton, William Philip Molyneux, Earl of, 1835-1897. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), (1870, Dec. 20), Liverpool (Eng.). JP 281

Sharp, Michael William, d. 1840. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([1826], June 27), London (Eng.). JP 282

Smith, Charles Roach, 1807-1890. 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831- 1912, A.L.S. (4 p.), (1881, Aug. 6), Strood (Kent, Eng.). JP 285

Smith, James, 1775-1839. “The Alphabet to Madame Vestris:” [poem], A.MS.S. (1 p.), (1834, Dec. [28?]). JP 286

Somerset, Jane Georgiana Seymour, Duchess of, 1809-1884. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (1 p.), ([ca. 1855?], May 24). JP 287

[Sotheby, William, 1757-1833]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L. (1 p.), ([1826], Apr. 8), London (Eng.). JP 288

In French.

[Stanfield, Clarkson, 1793-1867]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L. (1 p.), ([ca. 1860?]). JP 290

Written in third person.

[Stanley, Arthur Penrhyn, 1815-1881]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L. (1 p.), (1865, Feb. 14), London (Eng.). JP 291

Written in third person as Dean of Westminster.

[Staunton, Howard, 1810-1874]? 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), (1849, Sep. 22), London (Eng.). JP 292

[Stephens, Catherine, 1794-1882]. 1 letter to Katherine Frances Whelan, b. 1823, A.L.S. (4 p.), ([ca. 1870?]). JP 293

Signed: “C Essex” as the Countess of Essex.

[Stephens, Catherine, 1794-1882]. 1 letter to [Katherine Frances Whelan, b. 1823]?, A.L.S. (4 p.), ([ca. 1875?], Aug. 7), London (Eng.). JP 294

Signed: “C Essex” as the Countess of Essex; letter possibly written to William Curteis Whelan.

[Strafford, Alice Byng, Countess of, b. 1830]. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796- 1880, A.L.S. (2 p.), ([ca. 1865?]), London (Eng.). JP 295

Note: signed as Alice, Vicountess Enfield.

[Strafford, Francis Edmund Cecil Byng, Earl of, 1835-1918]. 1 letter to [Mrs. (Matilda Anne) Mackarness, 1826-1881]?, A.L.S. (3 p.), ([ca. 1879?], Dec. 27), London (Eng.). JP 296

Signed: “F. E. C. Byng.”

Strickland, Agnes, 1796-1874. 1 letter to J. R. (James Robinson) Planché, 1796-1880, A.L.S. (3 p.), (1841, May 10), London (Eng.). JP 297

[Tindall, C---- E----]? 1 letter to T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon) Croker, 1831-1912, A.L.S. (4 p.), (1882, Mar. 28), Dublin (Ire.). JP 307

Auber, D. F. E. (Daniel François Esprit), 1782-1871. “La petite glaneuse: chansonette:” [musical score], (1 piece), ([before 1871])

In French.

Boieldieu, A. (Adrien), 1775-1834. “Prelude:” [musical score], (2 pieces), ([before 1834])

Norfolk, Bernard Edward Howard, Duke of, 1765-1842. [Two tickets of admission to the Coronation of Queen Victoria], (2 pieces), ([1838])

Note: one ticket completed with “Mr. J. R. Planche.”

Palmerston, Henry John Temple, Viscount, 1784-1865: To the Officer commanding Tenterden Volunteer Infantry, Tenterden, Cinque Ports, (1 piece), (1810, Jan. 18)

Croker, T. F. Dillon (Thomas Francis Dillon), 1831-1912. [List of items sold in a Sotheby Auction sale, with prices], (1 piece), (1882, June 15), London (Eng.)

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “Appendix: Printed letters and A Complete List of Dramatic Productions of J. R. Planché:” [proof sheets], (1 piece, 23 pages), (1879, Oct. 1)

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “The Camp at the Olympic: Songs, Duets, etc.:” [printed text], (1 piece), (1853, Oct. 17)

Acquired from W. A. Myers, Mar. 1972.

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “The Good Woman in the Wood:” [printed text of fairy extravaganza], (1 piece), (1852)

Acquired from W. A. Myers, Mar. 1972.

Planché, J. R. (James Robinson), 1796-1880. “Mr. Buckstone’s Ascent of Mount Parnassus:” [printed text of panoramic extravaganza], (1 piece), (1853, Mar. 28)
